body.p:
To His excelleny
The Governor of Ky

Your Petitioner John Thompson states that on the day of August 1861. He was tried before James Wickett Esqr a Justice of the peace in & for Union County for a breach of the Peace Committed at the August Election for 1861 at Waelin precinct in said County of Union and was fined Eighteen Dollars

He says the difficulty, took place late in the evening of the election day, after most of the Crowd had got pretty merry, over the results of the election, and your Petitioner being a Southern Rights man, was insulted by some of the Crowd happen to strickke one of them and & for that was fined --

He will state that he is an old man the lawful father of twenty four children from three wives, thirteen of whom are living and two of them in the Southern army, That he is poor having only a small farm to support his wife & younger children He therefore asked your Excellency to remit said fine & promises to be her after as he was before
except this one occasion, a peaceable, & good citizen
The undersigned citizn of Union County ask the Governor to Release Mr Thompson from the foregoing fine, and though small to him it would be hard to pay

I know Mr Thompson has had more children than any man in the Country & is a good citizen W G Hughes
H F Deln
Ben T, Cisssell
E. S. Cowgill
